intro: Tritonia rubrolucens, commonly known as the red-lit violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with a distinctive red throat, which gives it its scientific name. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. Tritonia rubrolucens typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shady borders.
